03:57 <qwebirc97135> Does anyone know why I would get the following error message when I accept an INVITATION to join? Failed to execute the [include] macro  
03:59 <cjdelisle> Is there any other information with that?  
04:00 <cjdelisle> if you click on the "Failed to execute" does it expand?  
04:01 <qwebirc75229> has joined #xwiki  
04:03 <qwebirc75229> has left #xwiki  
04:04 <qwebirc12080> has joined #xwiki  
04:05 <qwebirc12080> Hi guys! Having issues installing on WebSphere 6.1 ... is WAS supported as an Appserver for XWiki?  
04:05 <cjdelisle> what's the problem?  
04:06 <qwebirc12080> having an issue similar to this :  
04:06 <qwebirc12080> http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.web.wiki.xwiki.user/15663  
04:07 <cjdelisle> "Component manager has not been initialized before lookup"  
04:07 <cjdelisle> that?  
04:07 <qwebirc12080> loading the page after install shows  "Error 500: Component manager has not been initialized before lookup for [org.xwiki.model.reference.DocumentReferenceResolver] for hint [currentmixed] "  
04:07 <jstoldt|Notebook> has quit  
04:08 <qwebirc12080> starting the application shows all kind of TagLib errors in the SystemOut  
04:08 <qwebirc12080> com.ibm.ws.jsp.taglib.TldParser logParseErrorMessage Failed to parse Tag Library [/WEB-INF/struts.tld]: JSPG0235E: The JSP container failed to load the TagExtraInfo class [org.apache.struts.taglib.EnumerateTei]  
04:09 <jstoldt|Notebook> has joined #xwiki  
04:09 <qwebirc12080> I'm just wondering whether I should keep trying or if it's just not supported  
04:09 <cjdelisle> I think I remember something about this. The problem was a collision of t libraries. with different versions.  
04:09 <qwebirc12080> none of the posts found in Google seem to have a successful outcome  
04:09 <cjdelisle> \*two  
04:10 <qwebirc97135> @cjdelisle: Great call.  Looks like they don't have access to view the document.  ok, we want to force users to register and login to see content, but this is preventing invitations.  Is there a way to do this?  
04:10 <qwebirc12080> would i be better off with a more recent build? i'm running the latest stable  
04:11 <cjdelisle> hrmf  
04:11 <cjdelisle> is now known as <qwebirc12345>  
04:12 <qwebirc12345> Lest you doubt, here is an xwiki installation running on websphere.  
04:12 <qwebirc12345> http://ladyserenakitty.com/bin/  
04:13 <qwebirc12080> so there is hope  
04:13 <qwebirc12345> qwebirc97135: Did you set the switch in the config to "don't allow unregistered users to view anything?"  
04:14 <qwebirc12080> is now known as <Vinny>  
04:14 <Vinny> is now known as <Vinz>  
04:14 <Vinz> is now known as <Vinzzzzzz>  
04:16 <qwebirc12345> is now known as <cjdelisle>  
04:16 <cjdelisle> ;)  
04:16 <cjdelisle> http://wiki.spagobi.org/xwiki/bin/view/spagobi\_server/WebSphere+Specific+issues#HConfigurethejsptaglibreferencecorreclty  
04:16 <cjdelisle> oh oops, not xwiki  
04:18 <Vinzzzzzz> they are running xwiki though  
04:18 <Vinzzzzzz> i wonder if settng the jsp level would help ...  
04:18 <Vinzzzzzz> it can't do any bad  
04:20 <cjdelisle> I didn't follow it that carefully but IIRC what needed to be done was to remove a library from the /WEB-INF/lib dir.  
04:22 <Vinzzzzzz> same error with xwiki-enterprise-web-3.0-rc-1.war ...  
04:22 <qwebirc97135> @qwebirc12345: Tried that but when I attempt to click the box, nothing happens.  I can check/uncheck other boxes, just not those.  
04:24 <qwebirc97135> Cannot check/uncheck boxes to allow/not allow unregisted users to do anything  
04:26 <cjdelisle> Ahh, I was wrong. That link I provided was running on glassfish. Still, we support the servlet container standard so we support websphere. Also it appears that people are indeed using websphere.  
04:30 <cjdelisle> Vinzzzzzz: can you pastebin some logs?  
04:30 <cjdelisle> qwebirc97135: How did you prevent users from seeing any pages in the wiki?  
04:30 <Vinzzzzzz> paste here?  
04:31 <cjdelisle> no. Pastebin like pastebin.com pr pastebay.com  
04:31 <kasun> has quit  
04:32 <cjdelisle>  From the leaked Win2K source code:  
04:32 <cjdelisle>  // The magnitude of this hack compares favorably with that of the national debt.  
04:33 <Vinzzzzzz> after starting the xwiki app: http://pastebin.com/DuYjMRxJ  
04:34 <qwebirc97135> cjdelisle: By unchecking the check box for Unregistered Users to View, but leaving Registered checked  
04:34 <qwebirc97135> cjdelisle:  I think I found a bug.  When I check one of the boxes that won't change, if I then refresh the page, the checkbox is then checked (and vise-versa)  
04:35 <Vinzzzzzz> after loading a page: http://pastebin.com/g0vA2tLw  
04:36 <cjdelisle> qwebirc97135: Do you have javascript disabled?  
04:38 <Vinzzzzzz> pwd  
04:39 <cjdelisle> ``WebSphere uses Struts 1.1 for its admin console, so you don't want your application classes being loaded before the server classes.''  
04:40 <cjdelisle> http://www.coderanch.com/t/79267/Websphere/WAS-RAD-does-not-load  
04:40 <cjdelisle> Looks like it might be a collision in versions of the struts library.  
04:41 <qwebirc97135> cjdelisle:no - javascript is fully enabled (running IE6).  The other checkboxes on the RIGHTS page work without incident  
04:42 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
04:42 <venkatesh> has quit  
04:43 <cjdelisle> You are running IE6?  
04:43 <cjdelisle> Abandon all hope  
04:44 <cjdelisle> It's not \_that\_ bad but IE6 is a 10 year old browser which has a lot of bugs.  
04:45 <cjdelisle> There are obsenities and references to IE in javascript comments in many many websites.  
04:45 <qwebirc97135> cjdelisle:  yeah I know - not my choice - company policy at the moment  
04:45 <cjdelisle> I understand. You run IE6, I run noscript (block javascript). We both have to accept a lower quality of service.  
04:46 <cjdelisle> Regarding those checkboxes: after you reload, do you have the box checked or unchecked?  
04:49 <qwebirc97135> If I click on them to check them and reload, they are checked (and vise-versa)  
04:49 <cjdelisle> Vinzzzzzz: Since that other site is actually glassfish, I can't provide evidence that there are actually any working websphere installations. I see a number of people having your problem and nobody has a reply so I tend to think it is de-facto not supported.  
04:50 <cjdelisle> qwebirc97135: Click and reload until "prevent anonymous users from viewing pages" is \_unchecked\_.  
04:52 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
04:53 <qwebirc97135> cjdelisle: thx  
04:53 <qwebirc97135> has left #xwiki  
04:53 <Vinzzzzzz> tried to change the class loader preferences but it creates other problems  
04:54 <Vinzzzzzz> i'm about to give up  
04:54 <Vinzzzzzz> actually it screwed up the whole WAS install :D  
04:55 <Vinzzzzzz> alright time to sleep, merci cjdelisle  
04:55 <cjdelisle> gnight.  
04:55 <cjdelisle> I will try to remember to ask if anyone remembers a websphere installation working.

09:25 <Tsuna\_> I've a problème with the enterprise version :s  
09:25 <cjdelisle> What's happening?  
09:26 <Tsuna\_> when I try to import the default xar file, nothing happend, the page just reload  
09:26 <cjdelisle> What system are you running on?  
09:27 <Tsuna\_> CentOS 5.5, with apache/tomcat and mysql

09:27 <cjdelisle> then upload the .xar file?  
09:28 <Tsuna\_> yes  
09:28 <cjdelisle> And the file uploads and you see the link?  
09:28 <pulasthi> has quit  
09:28 <Tsuna\_> what link ?  
09:29 <cjdelisle> When you select the file and click [Upload] that's when you have the problem?  
09:29 <Tsuna\_> Yes, I click on upload, my browser is waiting for the server during upload, and after that's finish the page just reload without any change  
09:30 <cjdelisle> I see. So something is wrong with attaching the file.  
09:30 <Tsuna\_> what can I do ?  
09:31 <cjdelisle> Hang on a second, I have an idea.  
09:31 <Tsuna\_> okay  
09:31 <Tsuna\_> thanks :)  
09:32 <cjdelisle> {{groovy}}println(System.getProperty('java.io.tmpdir')){{/groovy}}  
09:32 <cjdelisle> edit a page and paste that into it and view it.  
09:32 <cjdelisle> err no that won't work. no PR :/  
09:33 <Tsuna\_> I set /tmp/xwiki has the temp dir inside the xwiki.cfg file  
09:33 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <cjdelisle> let me thing a second. As guest you lack necessary permissions. Without importing the admin user you have no user to login as.  
09:34 <Tsuna\_> I've activate the superadmin account  
09:34 <cjdelisle> ahh good. That works  
09:35 <cjdelisle> Anyway attachment upload will fail if user tomcat55 doesn't have write permission on that dir.  
09:35 <Tsuna\_> okay ^^  
09:35 <Tsuna\_> the dir is /usr/share/tomcat5/temp   why that's not the folder I've set in the configuration file :s ??  
09:36 <cjdelisle> I think what happens is that tomcat overrides the specified temporary file but I have not looked at that code.  
09:36 <Tsuna\_> okay  
09:37 <Tsuna\_> now I've an execption  
09:37 <Tsuna\_> com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 0 in 11: Uncaught exception  
09:37 <cjdelisle> Can you pastebin the stack trace?  
09:38 <Tsuna\_> okay wait a sec  
09:39 <Tsuna\_> look there : http://tsuna.fr/error.log  
09:42 <cjdelisle> It says in NPE language that the file upload plugin is missing.  
09:42 <Tsuna\_> where is this plugin ?  
09:43 <cjdelisle> It's loaded by this line in xwiki.cfg  
09:43 <cjdelisle>        com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.fileupload.FileUploadPlugin,\  
09:44 <cjdelisle> It is a handler for the multipart http post which your browser sends when you upload a file.  
09:44 <jamesxu\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <Tsuna\_> this plugins seems to be loaded in the config file  
09:46 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <Tsuna\_> I'm restarting tomcat, maybe there is a problem with the right on the temp dir  
09:46 <jamesxu> has quit  
09:47 <Tsuna\_> Nothing change :s  
09:47 <evalica> has quit  
09:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki

09:49 <Tsuna\_> where are the logs ?  
09:50 <cjdelisle> on my system they end up in /usr/share/tomcat55/logs/  
09:51 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: how can I move a document from one wiki within another for example from dev:Drafts to platform:DevGuide ?  
09:51 <Tsuna\_> there is a PacketTooBigException  
09:52 <jamesxu\_> has quit  
09:52 <cjdelisle> Did you try to upload the .war file instead of the .xar? They look exactly the same.  
09:52 <cjdelisle> Also you have to increase the max\_packet\_size in mysql to ~20 MB  
09:53 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <cjdelisle> sburjan: the rename function is what you're looking for.  
09:53 <+sburjan> oh, so not copy  
09:54 <+sburjan> I was trying to play safe and use copy :D  
09:54 <cjdelisle> rename or copy,delete. Does the same thing internally or extrnally.  
09:55 <+sburjan> well copy doesn't work  
09:55 <cjdelisle> Hmm wasn't there something about PR for copy?  
09:55 <+sburjan> i have PR afaik  
09:55 <+sburjan> so I want to copy dev:Drafts.TranslationsTutorial -> platform:DevGuide.TranslationsTutorial  
09:56 <cjdelisle> hmm interwiki  
09:56 <+sburjan> yes  
09:57 <+sburjan> ok, I will simply re-create the page on the new space  
09:57 <+sburjan> :)  
09:57 <+sburjan> too bad we dno't have such an interwiki feature  
09:57 <pulasthi1> has quit  
09:57 <cjdelisle> I don't know if we do or not. It seems like we do but I can't remember.  
09:57 <Tsuna\_> how can I know the mysql max packet size ?  
09:58 <cjdelisle> If it's the default then it's like 3 bytes  
09:58 <cjdelisle> but it should be in my.conf  
09:58 <Tsuna\_> I use mysql --max\_packet\_size=32M -p to set it, but I don't have any confirm message  
09:59 <@sdumitriu> Tsuna\_: Open mysql, execute:  
09:59 <@sdumitriu> mysql> show variables like 'max\_allowed\_packet';  
10:00 <Tsuna\_> the value is 1048576, do you think, that's good ?  
10:01 <@sdumitriu> Tsuna\_: It's too small  
10:02 <Tsuna\_> okay -\_-  
10:02 <Tsuna\_> how to increase it ?
